result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

OFF RECORD / 11:24 AM Defendant Brandon Lee Froemel not in court.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court discussion speaks on DEF non appearance and active warrants in case. Court reviews court record. Warrants continue.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report:  436  additional contacts to SPD certified attorneys, however, no attorney  has agreed to represent this applicant.
Uploaded warrant document to ShareFile and sent paper copy to Sheriff's Department.  No warrant card generated.

10:49 AM Defendant Brandon Lee Froemel not in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Brandon Lee Froemel.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court reviews the court record and the violation report filed by Justice Point.    Court addresses Justice Point Representative H. Lessard,  makes statement to court.    Attny Gramstrup makes statement to court, and no contact with DEF.  State requests warrant and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Wisconsin and Surrounding States) as requested and bail forfeiture to begin.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.   Attny Gramstrup makes bond argument.   State no objection.   Discussion takes places.   Court addresses Justice Point Representative Heather Lessard.   Court modifies bond.   SIBS $5000    ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages. 02:28 PM Defendant Brandon Lee Froemel in court with attorney Chris A Gramstrup appears by video.  Defendant Brandon Lee Froemel in custody. Kenneth Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Gramstrup indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court enters NG Plea to Count 4.    Attny Gramstrup request preliminary hearing to be scheduled but waives time limits.  Bond Continues.  Off the record for scheduling.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
